page.title: 17More About the Houses
page.content:
The houses round our school were mainly built in the 1960s and 70s. There are a lot of semi-detached bungalows (many with dormers), built from red brick with tiled roofs. Those with garages had them at the back or side. Most of them had gardens which were small at the front and large at the back. Many of them had lawns with flower-beds around the edge.
The newer buildings were detached and semi-detached houses built of lighter brickwith tiled roofs. Very few had double garages, as the incidence of two car families was low.
Amenities in local housing include: central heading (mostly gas), double glazing, ownership of a car, freezer and a TV. Most cook by electricity.
